content: >http://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5gXbaM8IHY0RVTpK9YM-zcYTcTUHw Worl cases reported have topped out at 15 000 in virtually every country. The most rapidly developing infection sites are in Canada, the US and Australia - countries with notable levels of air travel, and few public restrictions. While morbity rermains low, 100 dead world-wide, the spread of the disease in the warm months is problematic. Thus far the disease seems to be following the same pattern as the 1918 pandemic - which started 'light' and took 6 months to develop into massive infection levels - with high death rates. A vaccine may not be ready if infection rates start to climb this fall.

title: Swine Flu Continues to Spread

content: i know a few guys who had the swine flu. they were barely sick. it was just like having the common cold. i was in quarantine with them because they thought i had it
